This course is a deep dive into pharmaceutical regulation in the US, and to an extent the rest of the world. You will learn all about the FDA and key players in it and around it, and learn from doctors, lawyers, and statisticians directly. For anyone interested in getting a real feel for the world of regulatory affairs, this class is a wonderful way to do so.

If you are interested in the Regulatory Affairs track or want to learn more about the inner workings of the FDA and pharma companies, this course is worthwhile.

This is a low workload type of course. The grading is very forgiving, and in general, you will not at all be stressed out by adding this to your schedule. At the same time, you will learn a tremendous amount about how regulatory affairs work - mainly through the speakers that Dr. Makuch invites throughout the semester. These are industry experts, and Dr. Makuch has a personal relationship with each and every one of them. This allows for lots of candid discussions, real-world observations, and real-time interactions that really expose how things work in regulatory affairs.
